attributes.magic: MS Windows shortcut, Item id list present, Points to a file or directory, Has Relative path, Has Working directory, Has command line arguments, Icon number=0, Archive, ctime=Wed Nov 15 10:40:33 2023, mtime=Sun Jan  7 06:26:55 2024, atime=Wed Nov 15 10:40:33 2023, length=32768, window=hide

crowdsourced_yara_results.description: Identifies PowerShell artefacts in shortcut (LNK) files.
crowdsourced_yara_results.author: @bartblaze

crowdsourced_yara_results.description: Identifies scripting artefacts in shortcut (LNK) files.
crowdsourced_yara_results.author: @bartblaze

crowdsourced_yara_results.description: Identifies executable artefacts in shortcut (LNK) files.
crowdsourced_yara_results.author: @bartblaze

crowdsourced_yara_results.description: Identifies archive (compressed) files in shortcut (LNK) files.
crowdsourced_yara_results.author: @bartblaze

crowdsourced_yara_results.description: Identifies Microsoft Office artefacts in shortcut (LNK) files.
crowdsourced_yara_results.author: @bartblaze

crowdsourced_yara_results.description: Identifies shortcut (LNK) file with a long relative path. Might be used in an attempt to hide the path.
crowdsourced_yara_results.author: @bartblaze

threat_severity.level_description: Severity HIGH because it was considered trojan. Other contributing factor was that it could not be run in sandboxes.

exiftool.Flags: IDList, LinkInfo, RelativePath, WorkingDir, CommandArgs, IconFile, Unicode, TargetMetadata

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Registering wscript to autostart run key for dropped js/vbs

match_context.values: @{RuleName=T1060,RunKey; EventID=13; Details=c:\windows\system32\wscript.exe //b //e:vbscript C:\\ProgramData\\R9147.vbs; Image=C:\Windows\System32\reg.exe; EventType=SetValue; TargetObject=HKU\S-1-5-21-4005801669-2598574594-602355426-1001\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run\Winload}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects modification of autostart extensibility point (ASEP) in registry.
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Victor Sergeev, Daniil Yugoslavskiy, Gleb Sukhodolskiy, Timur Zinniatullin, oscd.community, Tim Shelton, frack113 (split)

match_context.values: @{RuleName=T1060,RunKey; EventID=13; EventType=SetValue; Image=C:\Windows\System32\reg.exe; Details=c:\windows\system32\wscript.exe //b //e:vbscript C:\\ProgramData\\R9147.vbs; TargetObject=HKU\S-1-5-21-4005801669-2598574594-602355426-1001\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run\Winload}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Potential Persistence Attempt Via Run Keys Using Reg.EXE
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects suspicious command line reg.exe tool adding key to RUN key in Registry

match_context.values: @{Hashes=MD5=8A2122E8162DBEF04694B9C3E0B6CDEE,SHA256=B99D61D874728EDC0918CA0EB10EAB93D381E7367E377406E65963366C874450,IMPHASH=272245E2988E1E430500B852C4FB5E18; CurrentDirectory=C:\Windows\System32\; OriginalFileName=Cmd.Exe; Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; Description=Windows Command Processor; FileVersion=10.0.19041.746 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentCommandLine="C:\Windows\System32\WScript.exe" "C:\programdata\s.vbs" ; CommandLine="C:\Windows\System32\cmd.exe" /c reg add "HKCU\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run" /v Winload /t REG_SZ /d "c:\windows\system32\wscript.exe //b //e:vbscript C:\\ProgramData\\R9147.vbs" /f; EventID=1; ParentImage=C:\Windows\System32\wscript.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\System32\cmd.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

@{CommandLine=C:\Windows\System32\cmd.exe /c reg add HKCU\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run /v Winload /t REG_SZ /d c:\windows\system32\wscript.exe //b //e:vbscript C:\\ProgramData\\R9147.vbs /f; Image=C:\Windows\System32\cmd.exe; EventID=1}
@{CommandLine=reg add HKCU\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run /v Winload /t REG_SZ /d c:\windows\system32\wscript.exe //b //e:vbscript C:\\ProgramData\\R9147.vbs /f; Image=reg; EventID=1}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects direct modification of autostart extensibility point (ASEP) in registry using reg.exe.

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Potential Binary Or Script Dropper Via PowerShell
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects PowerShell creating a binary executable or a script file.

match_context.values: @{Image=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; TargetFilename=C:\ProgramData\s.vbs; EventID=11}
@{Image=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; EventID=11; TargetFilename=C:\ProgramData\R9147.vbs}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects the creation of scheduled tasks by user accounts via the "schtasks" utility.
